definition: of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
disco (loanword)/also written 迪斯科[di2 si1 ke1]

sentences.english: The taxi that towed us to the nearest town was just as bad.
sentences.chinese: 那輛拖着我們到最近市鎮的的士同樣破破爛爛。

sentences.english: After dinner, my friends in Thailand told us to go to a club for some fun.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯後，泰國的一班朋友叫我們到的士高玩。

sentences.english: Taxi fares are chargeable by offline credit card via the internet.
sentences.chinese: 的士車費會透過離線方式以信用咭收取。

sentences.english: And he judged Israel twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 參孫作以色列的士師二十年。
可以，我們就去喬伊的士高。

sentences.english: Is here a disco near by?
sentences.chinese: 我想問問附近有沒有的士高？

sentences.english: Try taxis or buses if walking becomes too much .
sentences.chinese: 若走路太多可試乘的士或巴士。

sentences.english: A: Would you like to see a movie or go to a disco?
sentences.chinese: 你想去看電影還是去的士高？

sentences.english: The Malay peninsula main cities of long-distance taxi billing some chronologically.
sentences.chinese: 馬來半島主要城市間的長途的士計費有的按時間計。

sentences.english: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons as judges for Israel.
sentences.chinese: 撒母耳年紀老邁，就立他兒子作以色列的士師。

sentences.english: A lazy monkey is sitting in a green taxi.
sentences.chinese: 一隻懶猴正坐在一輛綠色的士中。

sentences.english: The accident happened in Smyrna, Tennessee, near Nashville.
sentences.chinese: 這起事故發生在田納西州的士麥那。

sentences.english: You can also use the card in taxis and on buses.
sentences.chinese: 您還可以使用在的士及巴士上。

sentences.english: End with a shared taxi ride to Kigali, Rwanda.
sentences.chinese: 最後可以共乘的士去盧旺達的基加利。

sentences.english: It is used in small doses by veterinarians as a stimulant.
sentences.chinese: 獸醫有時候會使用小劑量的士的寧作興奮劑。

sentences.english: In Mumbai, taxis are readily available and reasonably priced.
sentences.chinese: 在孟買，的士隨處可見，價格公道。

definition: soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
Shilin or Shihlin district of Taipei City 臺北市|台北市[Tai2 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
